verses.text: <a href="../2-Samuel-7-1/" title="2 Samuel 7:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1  "JESUS_END"And it came to pass, when the king sat in his house, and the LORD had given him rest round about from all his enemies;

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-2/" title="2 Samuel 7:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2  "JESUS_END"That the king said unto Nathan the prophet, See now, I dwell in an house of cedar, but the ark of God dwelleth within curtains.
3 "JESUS_END"And Nathan said to the king, Go, do all that is in thine heart; for the LORD is with thee.
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-4/" title="2 Samuel 7:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4  "JESUS_END"And it came to pass that night, that the word of the LORD came unto Nathan, saying,

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-5/" title="2 Samuel 7:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5  "JESUS_END"Go and tell my servant David, Thus saith the LORD, Shalt thou build me an house for me to dwell in?
6 "JESUS_END"Whereas I have not dwelt in any house since the time that I brought up the children of Israel out of Egypt, even to this day, but have walked in a tent and in a tabernacle.

7 "JESUS_END"In all the places wherein I have walked with all the children of Israel spake I a word with any of the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people Israel, saying, Why build ye not me an house of cedar?

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-8/" title="2 Samuel 7:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8  "JESUS_END"Now therefore so shalt thou say unto my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people, over Israel:

9 "JESUS_END"And I was with thee whithersoever thou wentest, and have cut off all thine enemies out of thy sight, and have made thee a great name, like unto the name of the great men that are in the earth.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-10/" title="2 Samuel 7:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10  "JESUS_END"Moreover I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more, as beforetime,

11 "JESUS_END"And as since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel, and have caused thee to rest from all thine enemies. Also the LORD telleth thee that he will make thee an house.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-12/" title="2 Samuel 7:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12  "JESUS_END"And when thy days be fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy bowels, and I will establish his kingdom.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-13/" title="2 Samuel 7:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13  "JESUS_END"He shall build an house for my name, and I will stablish the throne of his kingdom for ever.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-14/" title="2 Samuel 7:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14  "JESUS_END"I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he commit iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men:
15 "JESUS_END"But my mercy shall not depart away from him, as I took it from Saul, whom I put away before thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-16/" title="2 Samuel 7:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16  "JESUS_END"And thine house and thy kingdom shall be established for ever before thee: thy throne shall be established for ever.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-17/" title="2 Samuel 7:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17  "JESUS_END"According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak unto David.
18 "JESUS_END"Then went king David in, and sat before the LORD, and he said, Who am I, O Lord GOD? and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?
19 "JESUS_END"And this was yet a small thing in thy sight, O Lord GOD; but thou hast spoken also of thy servant's house for a great while to come. And is this the manner of man, O Lord GOD?
<a href="../2-Samuel-7-20/" title="2 Samuel 7:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20  "JESUS_END"And what can David say more unto thee? for thou, Lord GOD, knowest thy servant.
21 "JESUS_END"For thy word's sake, and according to thine own heart, hast thou done all these great things, to make thy servant know them.
22 "JESUS_END"Wherefore thou art great, O LORD God: for there is none like thee, neither is there any God beside thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

23 "JESUS_END"And what one nation in the earth is like thy people, even like Israel, whom God went to redeem for a people to himself, and to make him a name, and to do for you great things and terrible, for thy land, before thy people, which thou redeemedst to thee from Egypt, from the nations and their gods?
24 "JESUS_END"For thou hast confirmed to thyself thy people Israel to be a people unto thee for ever: and thou, LORD, art become their God.
25 "JESUS_END"And now, O LORD God, the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, and concerning his house, establish it for ever, and do as thou hast said.
26 "JESUS_END"And let thy name be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts is the God over Israel: and let the house of thy servant David be established before thee.

<a href="../2-Samuel-7-27/" title="2 Samuel 7:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27  "JESUS_END"For thou, O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, hast revealed to thy servant, saying, I will build thee an house: therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray this prayer unto thee.
28 "JESUS_END"And now, O Lord GOD, thou art that God, and thy words be true, and thou hast promised this goodness unto thy servant:

29 "JESUS_END"Therefore now let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue for ever before thee: for thou, O Lord GOD, hast spoken it: and with thy blessing let the house of thy servant be blessed for ever.
